name: Application Cache
doc:
Detects support for the Application Cache, for storing data to enable web-based applications run offline.

The API has been heavily criticized and discussions are underway to address this.

name: Battery API
doc: Detect support for the Battery API, for accessing information about the system's battery charge level.

name: Blob constructor
doc: Detects support for the Blob constructor, for creating file-like objects of immutable, raw data.

name: Canvas
doc: Detects support for the <canvas> element for 2D drawing.

name: Canvas text
doc: Detects support for the text APIs for <canvas> elements.

name: Content Editable
knownBugs: This is known to false positive in some mobile browsers. Here is a whitelist of verified working browsers: http://bit.ly/15RIQ9A
doc: Detects support for the contenteditable attribute of elements, allowing their DOM text contents to be edited directly by the user.

name: Content Security Policy
doc: Detects support for the Content Security Policy protocol for mitigating and reporting security attacks.

name: Context menus
doc: Detects support for custom context menus.

name: Cookies
doc: Detects whether cookie support is enabled.

name: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing

polyfills.name: pmxdr
notes: Implements a CORS-compliant cross-domain XMLHttpRequest with postMessage. Note that sites being requested must have a pmxdr host.

doc: Detects support for Cross-Origin Resource Sharing: method of performing XMLHttpRequests across domains.

name: Custom protocol handler
doc: Detects support for the window.registerProtocolHandler() API to allow web sites to register themselves as possible handlers for particular protocols.

name: Dart
doc: Detects native support for the Dart programming language.

name: DataView
doc: Detects support for the DataView interface for reading data from an ArrayBuffer as part of the Typed Array spec.

name: Drag & Drop
doc: Detects support for native drag & drop of elements.

name: Emoji
doc: Detects support for emoji character sets.

name: EXIF Orientation
doc:
Detects support for EXIF Orientation in JPEG images.

iOS looks at the EXIF Orientation flag in JPEGs and rotates the image accordingly. Most desktop browsers just ignore this data.

name: GamePad API
doc: Detects support for the Gamepad API, for access to gamepads and controllers.

name: Geolocation API

polyfills.name: Geolocation Shim
notes: Uses Google ClientLocation API as a fallback

polyfills.name: geo-location-javascript
notes: Mobile-centric: uses non-standard Blackberry and WebOS tricks

doc: Detects support for the Geolocation API for users to provide their location to web applications.

name: Hashchange event
doc: Detects support for the hashchange event, fired when the current location fragment changes.

name: History API
doc: Detects support for the History API for manipulating the browser session history.

name: IE8 compat mode
doc: Detects whether or not the current browser is IE8 in compatibility mode (i.e. acting as IE7).

name: IndexedDB
doc: Detects support for the IndexedDB client-side storage API (final spec).

name: Input attributes
doc:
Detects support for HTML5 <input> element attributes and exposes Boolean subproperties with the results:

Modernizr.input.autocomplete
Modernizr.input.autofocus
Modernizr.input.list
Modernizr.input.max
Modernizr.input.min
Modernizr.input.multiple
Modernizr.input.pattern
Modernizr.input.placeholder
Modernizr.input.required
Modernizr.input.step

name: Form input types
doc:
Detects support for HTML5 form input types and exposes Boolean subproperties with the results:

Modernizr.inputtypes.color
Modernizr.inputtypes.date
Modernizr.inputtypes.datetime
Modernizr.inputtypes['datetime-local']
Modernizr.inputtypes.email
Modernizr.inputtypes.month
Modernizr.inputtypes.number
Modernizr.inputtypes.range
Modernizr.inputtypes.search
Modernizr.inputtypes.tel
Modernizr.inputtypes.time
Modernizr.inputtypes.url
Modernizr.inputtypes.week

name: JSON
doc: Detects native support for JSON handling functions.

name: Reverse Ordered Lists
doc: Detects support for the reversed attribute on the <ol> element.

name: MathML
doc: Detects support for MathML, for mathematic equations in web pages.

name: Notifications
doc: Detects support for the Notifications API, for notifying the user of events regardless of which tab has focus.

name: Page Visibility API
doc: Detects support for the Page Visibility API, which can be used to disable unnecessary actions and otherwise improve user experience.

name: Navigation Timing API
doc: Detects support for the Navigation Timing API, for measuring browser and connection performance.

name: DOM Pointer Events API
notes: This property name used to refer to the CSS `pointer-events` property, which is now named `csspointerevents`.
warnings: This property name now refers to W3C DOM PointerEvents: https://github.com/Modernizr/Modernizr/issues/548#issuecomment-12812099

polyfills.name: Hand.js
notes: Implements the Pointer Events API

doc: Detects support for the DOM Pointer Events API, which provides a unified event interface for pointing input devices, as implemented in IE10+.

name: postMessage

polyfills.name: easyXDM
notes: Implements XDM and RPC in most browsers since IE6. Also ships with an endpoint for exposing ajax across the domain boundary.

doc: Detects support for the window.postMessage protocol for cross-document messaging.

name: requestAnimationFrame
doc: Detects support for the window.requestAnimationFrame API, for offloading animation repainting to the browser for optimized performance.

name: SVG

polyfills.name: RaphaÃ«l
notes: Abstracted API. adds features. fallback for IE via VML

polyfills.name: canvg
notes: Writes SVG to canvas. Good for Android

polyfills.name: SVG Boilerplate
notes: Alpha and still buggy, but handle multiple concurrent SVG shims together

polyfills.name: SIE SVG library
notes: Fallback to VML for oldIE

polyfills.name: Dojo GFX
notes: Fallback via VML, Canvas, Silverlight and Flash

doc: Detects support for SVG in <embed> or <object> elements.

name: Typed arrays
doc:
Detects support for native binary data manipulation via Typed Arrays in JavaScript.

Does not check for DataView support; use Modernizr.dataview for that.

name: Unicode characters
warnings: positive Unicode support doesn't mean you can use it inside <title>, this seams more related to OS & Language packs
doc: Detects if unicode characters are supported in the current document.

name: IE User Data API
doc: Detects support for IE userData for persisting data, an API similar to localStorage but supported since IE5.

name: Vibration API
doc: Detects support for the API that provides access to the vibration mechanism of the hosting device, to provide tactile feedback.

name: HTML5 Video
doc:
Detects support for the video element, as well as testing what types of content it supports.

Subproperties are provided to describe support for ogg, h264 and webm formats, e.g.:

Modernizr.video         // true
Modernizr.video.ogg     // 'probably'

name: Web Intents
doc:
Detects native support for the Web Intents APIs for service discovery and inter-application communication.

Chrome added support for this in v19, but removed it again in v24 because of "a number of areas for development in both the API and specific user experience in Chrome". No other browsers currently support it, however a JavaScript shim is available.

name: WebSockets Support
warnings: This test will reject any old version of WebSockets even if it is not prefixed such as in Safari 5.1

name: a[download] Attribute
doc: When used on an <a>, this attribute signifies that the resource it points to should be downloaded by the browser rather than navigating to it.

polyfills.name: XAudioJS
notes: Audio sample stream output thin-abstraction library that supports mono and stereo audio, as well as resampling the audio stream.
Supports the Mozilla Audio Data API, Web Audio API, Adobe Flash 10, real-time WAV PCM Data URI generation

polyfills.name: audiolib.js
notes: specs: incubator group proposed spec, Mozilla Audio Data API (temporary)

polyfills.name: XAudioJS
notes: Audio sample stream output thin-abstraction library that supports mono and stereo audio, as well as resampling the audio stream.
Supports the Mozilla Audio Data API, Web Audio API, Adobe Flash 10, real-time WAV PCM Data URI generation

polyfills.name: audiolib.js
notes: specs: incubator group proposed spec, Mozilla Audio Data API (temporary)

name: Low Battery Level
doc: Enable a developer to remove CPU intensive CSS/JS when battery is low

name: CSS Animations
warnings: Android < 4 will pass this test, but can only animate a single property at a time

notes.name: Article: 'Dispelling the Android CSS animation myths'

name: Background Size
knownBugs: This will false positive in Opera Mini - http://github.com/Modernizr/Modernizr/issues/396

polyfills.name: CSS3 PIE
notes: CSS3 decoration rendering for IE 6-9. Supports: border-radius, box-shadow, multiple backgrounds, linear gradients, border-image

polyfills.name: CSS3 PIE
notes: CSS3 decoration rendering for IE 6-9. Supports: border-radius, box-shadow, multiple backgrounds, linear gradients, border-image

name: Box Shadow
knownBugs: WebOS false positives on this test.

polyfills.name: borderBoxModel
notes: box-sizing: border-box; javascript polyfill for IE6+

polyfills.name: box-sizing-polyfill
notes: box-sizing: border-box; for IE6 and IE7 via Microsoft's proprietary CSS behavior / .htc-script

polyfills.name: Borderbox for Compass
notes: box-sizing: border-box; polyfill for SASS/Compass. Outputs equivalent CSS for IE6 & 7

name: CSS Calc
doc:
Method of allowing calculated values for length units. For example:

#elem {
  width: calc(100% - 3em);
}

polyfills.name: css3-multi-column.js
notes: Supported Properties: column-count, column-width, column-gap, column-rule.

Unsupported Properties: column-rule-width (use column-rule instead), column-rule-style (use column-rule instead), column-rule-color (use column-rule instead), column-span, column-width-policy, column-space-distribution

name: CSS Cubic Bezier Range
warnings: cubic-bezier values can't be > 1 for Webkit until [bug #45761](https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=45761) is fixed

name: CSS Display table
doc:
display: table and table-cell test. (both are tested under one name table-cell )

All additional table display values are here: http://pastebin.com/Gk9PeVaQ though Scott has seen some IE false positives with that sort of weak detection. More testing neccessary perhaps.

polyfills.name: Polyfilter
notes: CSS filter effects for Chrome 20+, Safari 6+, Firefox 4+, IE 6 - 9 and some mobile browsers.

polyfills.name: Flexie
notes: Flexible box model - old spec from 2009. (flexbox) Supports: box-orient, box-align, box-direction, box-pack, box-flex, box-ordinal-group

name: CSS Generated Content
warnings: Android won't return correct height for anything below 7px #738

name: CSS HSLA Colors
notes: Same as rgba(), in fact, browsers re-map hsla() to rgba() internally, except IE9 who retains it as hsla

name: CSS Hyphens
warnings: These tests currently require document.body to be present
If loading Hyphenator.js via Modernizr.load, be cautious of issue 158: http://code.google.com/p/hyphenator/issues/detail?id=158
This is very large â only include it if you absolutely need it
notes: csshyphens - tests hyphens:auto actually adds hyphens to text
softhyphens - tests that ­ does its job
softhyphensfind - tests that in-browser Find functionality still works correctly with ­

notes.name: The Current State of Hyphenation on the Web.

name: CSS Mask
notes: This is for the -webkit-mask feature, not for the similar svg mask in Firefox.

name: CSS Opacity
notes: Opacity must be be in the range of [0.0,1.0], according to the spec.

name: CSS Overflow Scrolling
warnings: Introduced in iOS5b2. API is subject to change.

notes.name: Font Size with rem by Jonathan Snook

name: CSS textshadow
knownBugs: FF3.0 will false positive on this test

name: CSS Transforms 3D
warnings: Chrome may occassionally fail this test on some systems; more info: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=129004

name: datalist Element
warnings: This test is a dupe of Modernizr.input.list. Only around for legacy reasons.

name: Track element and Timed Text Track API
warnings: While IE10 has implemented the track element, IE10 does not expose the underlying APIs to create timed text tracks by JS (really sad)

name: ES5 Array
doc: Check if browser implements ECMAScript 5 Array per specification.

name: ES5 Date
doc: Check if browser implements ECMAScript 5 Date per specification.

name: ES5 Function
doc: Check if browser implements ECMAScript 5 Function per specification.

name: ES5 Object

polyfills.name: ES5 Sham
notes: Adds the rest of Object, read carefully before using

doc: Check if browser implements ECMAScript 5 Object per specification.

name: ES5 Strict Mode
doc: Check if browser implements ECMAScript 5 Object strict mode.

name: ES5 String
doc: Check if browser implements ECMAScript 5 String per specification.

name: ES5 String.prototype.contains
doc: Check if browser implements ECMAScript 6 String.prototype.contains per specification.

name: Device Orientation and Motion Events
doc:
Part of Device Access aspect of HTML5, same category as geolocation.

devicemotion tests for Device Motion Event support, returns boolean value true/false.

deviceorientation tests for Device Orientation Event support, returns boolean value true/false

name: File API
knownBugs: Will fail in Safari 5 due to its lack of support for the standards defined FileReader object
doc:
filereader tests for the File API specification

Tests for objects specific to the File API W3C specification without being redundant (don't bother testing for Blob since it is assumed to be the File object's prototype.)

name: Filesystem API
knownBugs: The API will be present in Chrome incognito, but will throw an exception. See crbug.com/93417

name: input[capture] Attribute
doc: When used on an <input>, this attribute signifies that the resource it takes should be generated via device's camera, camcorder, sound recorder.

name: input[file] Attribute
doc:
Detects whether input type="file" is available on the platform

E.g. iOS < 6 and some android version don't support this

name: input[form] Attribute
doc: Detects whether input form="form_id" is available on the platform E.g. IE 10 (and below), don't support this

name: input[type="number"] Localization
doc: Detects whether input type="number" is capable of receiving and displaying localized numbers, e.g. with comma separator

name: placeholder attribute
doc: Tests for placeholder attribute in inputs and textareas

name: form#requestAutocomplete()
doc: When used with input[autocomplete] to annotate a form, form.requestAutocomplete() shows a dialog in Chrome that speeds up checkout flows (payments specific for now).

name: Speech Input for inputs
knownBugs: This detect only checks the webkit version because the speech attribute is likely to be deprecated in favor of a JavaScript API.

name: Form Validation
doc:
This implementation only tests support for interactive form validation. To check validation for a specific type or a specific other constraint, the test can be combined:

  • Modernizr.inputtypes.number && Modernizr.formvalidation (browser supports rangeOverflow, typeMismatch etc. for type=number)
  • Modernizr.input.required && Modernizr.formvalidation (browser supports valueMissing)

name: iframe[sandbox] Attribute
doc: Test for sandbox attribute in iframes.

name: iframe[seamless] Attribute
doc: Test for seamless attribute in iframes.

name: iframe[srcdoc] Attribute
doc: Test for srcdoc attribute in iframes.

name: Animated PNG
doc: Test for animated png support.

name: Webp Lossless
doc: Tests for lossless webp support.

name: Webp
doc: Tests for webp support.

name: Low Bandwidth Connection
doc:
Tests for determining low-bandwidth via navigator.connection

There are two iterations of the navigator.connection interface.

The first is present in Android 2.2+ and only in the Browser (not WebView)

  • http://docs.phonegap.com/en/1.2.0/phonegap_connection_connection.md.html#connection.type
  • http://davidbcalhoun.com/2010/using-navigator-connection-android

The second is specced at http://dev.w3.org/2009/dap/netinfo/ and perhaps landing in WebKit

  • http://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=73528

Unknown devices are assumed as fast

For more rigorous network testing, consider boomerang.js: http://github.com/bluesmoon/boomerang/

name: Server Sent Events
doc: Tests for server sent events aka eventsource.

name: XML HTTP Request Level 2 XHR2
doc: Tests for XHR2.

name: script[async]
doc: Detects support for the async attribute on the <script> element.

name: script[defer]
warnings: Browser implementation of the `defer` attribute vary: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3952009/defer-attribute-chrome#answer-3982619
doc: Detects support for the defer attribute on the <script> element.

name: style[scoped]

polyfills.name: Scoped Styles
notes: jQuery Plugin to enable the scoped attribute on style blocks so they only affect their parent element's children.

doc: Support for the scoped attribute of the <style> element.

name: SVG clip paths
doc:
Detects support for clip paths in SVG (only, not on HTML content).

See this discussion regarding applying SVG clip paths to HTML content.

name: Inline SVG
doc: Detects support for inline SVG in HTML (not within XHTML).

name: Data URI
warnings: Support in Internet Explorer 8 is limited to images and linked resources like CSS files, not HTML files
doc:
Detects support for data URIs. Provides a subproperty to report support for data URIs over 32kb in size:

Modernizr.datauri           // true
Modernizr.datauri.over32kb  // false in IE8

name: Video Autoplay
warnings: This test is very large â only include it if you absolutely need it

notes.name: Article: 'Dispelling the Android CSS animation myths'

doc: Checks for support of the autoplay attribute of the video element.

name: WebGL Extensions
doc:
Detects support for OpenGL extensions in WebGL. It's true if the WebGL extensions API is supported, then exposes the supported extensions as subproperties, e.g.:

if (Modernizr.webglextensions) {
  // WebGL extensions API supported
}
if ('OES_vertex_array_object' in Modernizr.webglextensions) {
  // Vertex Array Objects extension supported
}

notes.name: W3C Media Capture and Streams spec

name: Framed window
doc: Tests if page is iframed.

name: Workers from Blob URIs
knownBugs: This test may output garbage to console.
doc: Detects support for creating Web Workers from Blob URIs.

name: Workers from Data URIs
knownBugs: This test may output garbage to console.
doc: Detects support for creating Web Workers from Data URIs.

name: Shared Workers
doc: Detects support for the SharedWorker API from the Web Workers spec.

name: Web Workers
doc: Detects support for the basic Worker API from the Web Workers spec. Web Workers provide a simple means for web content to run scripts in background threads.
